Term.Name: All
Term.Definition: This means that all types of media are covered by the right
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Cable
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Cable Pay TV
Term.Definition: This means services in which the delivery of the material is done through cable medium and for which a charge for admission to the service is made
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Cable TV On-demand
Term.Definition: This means that the delivery of the material is done through cable propagation medium and that the deliverer provides an application catalogue from which consumers may choose. Besides a charge for admission is made
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Cable Pay-per-view TV
Term.Definition: This means services in which the delivery of the material is done through cable medium and for which a charge is made for user's fruition of programmes selected by himself/herself
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Downloadable
Term.Definition: This includes all services for which the fruition of the material is achieved through a data downloading, regardless of the propagation medium and of the access policy
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Free
Term.Definition: This embraces all kind of free services regardless of the propagation medium and of delivery mechanism
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Home Video/Audio
Term.Definition: This means that the delivery of the material is done through the distribution and sale of storage formats suitable to be played by consumer profile devices, like CD, VHS, DVD, Video Disc
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Internet
Term.Definition: This means that the delivery of the material is done through TCP/IP network protocol regardless of the kind of application protocol (i.e. http, ftp, streaming etc.)
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Internet On-demand
Term.Definition: This means that the delivery of the material is done through TCP/IP network protocol regardless of the kind of application protocol (i.e. http, ftp, streaming etc.) and that the deliverer provides an application catalogue from which consumers may choose. Besides a charge for admission is made
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Internet Public Site
Term.Definition: This means that the delivery of the material is done through TCP/IP network protocol regardless of the kind of application protocol (i.e. http, ftp, streaming etc.) and that there is no tracking or registering procedures of the consumers' access to the published material
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Internet Restricted Access Site
Term.Definition: This means that the delivery of the material is done through TCP/IP network protocol regardless of the kind of application protocol (i.e. http, ftp, streaming etc.) and that there is a mechanism for tracking and registering the consumers' access to the published material
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Pay Media
Term.Definition: This embraces all kind of services with charge for admission, regardless of the propagation medium and of delivery mechanism
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Radio
Term.Definition: This means the RADIO broadcast through terrestrial propagation medium
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Restricted Access media
Term.Definition: This embraces all kind of restricted access services without charge for admission, regardless of the propagation medium and of delivery mechanism
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Satellite
Term.Definition: This embraces all kind of satellite services regardless of the access policy
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Satellite Free TV
Term.Definition: This means services broadcast through satellite transponder medium
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Satellite Pay TV
Term.Definition: This means services in which the delivery of the material is done through satellite transponders and for which a charge for admission to the service is made
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Satellite Pay-per-view TV
Term.Definition: This means services in which the delivery of the material is done through satellite transponders and for which a charge is made for user's fruition of programmes selected by himself/herself
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Streaming Media
Term.Definition: This includes all services for which the fruition of the material is achieved through a data stream decoding, regardless of the propagation medium and of the access policy
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Terrestrial
Term.Definition: This embraces all kind of terrestrial services regardless of the access policy
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Terrestrial Free TV
Term.Definition: This means the TV broadcast through terrestrial propagation medium. Access is free of charge (this includes the public broacast services although they could be financed partly or totally by a government licence fee)
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Terrestrial Pay TV
Term.Definition: This means services in which the delivery of the TV material is done through terrestrial propagation medium and for which a charge for admission to the service is made
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Interactive TV
Term.Definition: This means that the delivery service is done in association with content enriching applications such as electronic programme guides, on line catalogues etc. running on the consumers' set top box
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Theatrical Distribution
Term.Definition: This means exhibition to audiences in places where a charge for admission is made including, but not limited to, cinemas and concert halls
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Removable Media
Term.Definition: Optical or magnetic disk, memory stick, tape, film, Vynil, etc.
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML
